questions.question: Think about your college life outside of classes. Which scene feels like 'you'?

options.option: Engaging in workshops that help you learn new skills.
Discovering new cafes and hidden spots around campus.
Attending college festivals and bonding with peers.
Relaxing in your dorm room with a good book or game.

questions.question: You’re in your first year of college, and there’s an opportunity to explore new horizons. What excites you the most?

options.option: A research internship at a top firm.
Participating in a student-run club or society.
A semester exchange program in another country.
Working closely with professors on an exciting project.

questions.question: Imagine you’re flipping through a college brochure. Which headline catches your attention the most?

options.option: Explore the World of Science and Innovation!
Unleash Your Creativity with Our Design Programs!
Delve into Culture and Society with Our Humanities Studies!
Become a Business Leader with Our Management Courses!

questions.question: Your college offers an extra opportunity to make your journey special. Which one would you choose?

options.option: An in-depth project that lets you dive deeper into your major.
A short course that lets you explore a new interest.
A certification course that complements your studies.
An intensive workshop that provides hands-on experience.

questions.question: You’ve got a free afternoon at college. Where are you most likely to spend your time?

options.option: In a study circle discussing global history.
In the art studio, creating something unique.
In a networking session with entrepreneurs.
In a high-tech lab, experimenting with new ideas.

questions.question: If you haven't yet taken the EmSAT/SAT, can you still apply for admission to IIT Delhi - Abu Dhabi?

options.option: Yes, but you must indicate 'yet to appear' during registration and submit a valid score before selection.
No, the test score is optional for CAET.
Yes, but the score is not required for admission.
No, you must have a valid score at the time of registration.

questions.question: What makes Abu Dhabi a great place for students at IIT Delhi - Abu Dhabi?

options.option: It is a bustling city with limited cultural experiences.
The climate is cold and restrictive.
Abu Dhabi is known for its safety, vibrant lifestyle, and rich cultural tapestry, making it ideal for students.
It is a secluded location with minimal international community presence.

questions.question: Which of the following options are acceptable for undergraduate admission to IIT Delhi - Abu Dhabi? (Select all that apply)

options.option: Students who have a valid EmSAT/SAT score.
Students who haven't taken an English proficiency test yet but will provide a score in their first semester.
Students who have appeared for the CAET 2024.
Students who have completed their K-12 education in an English-medium institution.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes student life at IIT Delhi - Abu Dhabi?

options.option: Only online resources are available without any on-campus engagement.
It is purely focused on academics without extracurricular activities.
Students have access to cultural events, inter-IIT competitions, and enriching academic resources.
There are limited opportunities for social engagement.

questions.question: If you could choose a nickname for yourself, what would it be?
When you think about college, which scene resonates with you the most?

options.option: Working on a solo assignment in a quiet library.
Presenting a project with a group of classmates.
Leading a team in a sports competition.
Volunteering at a community service event.

questions.question: You just got accepted into your dream school! What’s the first thing you’d like your new classmates to know about you?

options.option: I love being part of team activities.
I prefer working on my own.
I’m passionate about helping out in the community.
I’m always up for a sports challenge.

questions.question: Picture your perfect weekend activity at school. What would you choose?

options.option: Joining a study group to prepare for an upcoming exam.
Heading to the gym or participating in a sports event.
Attending a local cultural event or community meetup.
Spending time reading or working on a personal project.

questions.question: Imagine you’re in a classroom filled with students from different programs. Which group do you see yourself sitting with?

options.option: The students working on hands-on technical projects.
Those discussing the latest scientific discoveries.
The group planning a business pitch or discussing the stock market.
The ones sketching and talking about new art trends.
